body_html:
Yes we do have predefined macros for CPU code already.
However if we build both CPU/GPU as dll, we'll have a gpu->cpu DLL dependency and needs to have different macros.
Re-using CAFFE2_BUILD_MAIN_LIB with GPU module in this case will cause export of decl-only symbols.
body_text:
Yes we do have predefined macros for CPU code already.
However if we build both CPU/GPU as dll, we'll have a gpu->cpu DLL dependency and needs to have different macros.
Re-using CAFFE2_BUILD_MAIN_LIB with GPU module in this case will cause export of decl-only symbols.
body:
Yes we do have predefined macros for CPU code already.
However if we build both CPU/GPU as dll, we'll have a gpu->cpu DLL dependency and needs to have different macros.
Re-using `CAFFE2_BUILD_MAIN_LIB` with GPU module in this case will cause export of decl-only symbols.
